verses.verse: How beautiful <S%H3302><s%> are thy feet <S%H6471><s%> in sandals <S%H5275><s%>, O prince <S%H5081><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%>! Thy rounded <S%H2542><s%> thighs <S%H3409><s%> are like jewels <S%H2481><s%>, The work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of a skilful workman <S%H542><s%>.

Thy body <S%H8326><s%> is like a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet <S%H101><s%>, Wherein no mingled <S%H2637><s%> wine <S%H4197><s%> is wanting <S%H990><s%>: Thy waist is like a heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> Set about <S%H5473><s%> with lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
Thy two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two8147, Joshua82 fawns <S%H6646><s%> That are twins of a roe <S%H8380><s%>.

Thy neck <S%H6677><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%>; Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> as the pools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon <S%H2809><s%>, By the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bath-rabbim <S%H1337><s%>; Thy nose <S%H639><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> Which looketh <S%H6822><s%> toward <S%H6440><s%> Damascus <S%H1834><s%>.

Thy head <S%H7218><s%> upon thee is like Carmel <S%H3760><s%>, And the hair <S%H1803><s%> of thy head <S%H7218><s%> like purple <S%H713><s%>; The king <S%H4428><s%> is held <S%H631><s%> captive in the tresses thereof <S%H7298><s%>.
How fair <S%H3302><s%> and how pleasant <S%H5276><s%> art thou <S%H160><s%>, O love, for delights <S%H8588><s%>!
This thy stature <S%H6967><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> to a palm-tree <S%H8558><s%>, And thy breasts <S%H7699><s%> to its clusters <S%H811><s%>.

I said <S%H559><s%>, I will climb up <S%H5927><s%> into the palm-tree <S%H8558><s%>, I will take hold <S%H270><s%> of the branches <S%H5577><s%> thereof <S%H7699><s%>: Let thy breasts be as clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine <S%H1612><s%>, And the smell <S%H7381><s%> of thy breath <S%H639><s%> like apples <S%H8598><s%>,

And thy mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%>, That goeth <S%H1980><s%> down smoothly <S%H4339><s%> for my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, Gliding <S%H1680><s%> through the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those that are asleep <S%H3463><s%>.
I am my beloved <S%H1730><s%>'s; And his desire is toward me <S%H8669><s%>.
Come <S%H3212><s%>, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, let us go forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%>; Let us lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the villages <S%H3723><s%>.

Let us get up early <S%H7925><s%> to the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; Let us see <S%H7200><s%> whether the vine <S%H1612><s%> hath budded <S%H6524><s%>, And its blossom <S%H6524><s%> is open <S%H6605><s%>, And the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> are in flower <S%H5132><s%>: There will I give <S%H5414><s%> thee my love <S%H1730><s%>.

The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> forth fragrance <S%H7381><s%>; And at our doors <S%H6607><s%> are all manner of precious <S%H4022><s%> fruits <S%H2319><s%>, new and old <S%H3465><s%>, Which I have laid up <S%H6845><s%> for thee <S%H1730><s%>, O my beloved.
